newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-FERNANDEZ WINS MEN'S 100 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-FERNANDEZ WINS MEN'S 100 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.

text.p: Venezuelan Fernando Sanchez raced away with the men's 100 metres freestyle title at the world short-course swimming championships on Saturday.
Sanchez, who won the 50 freestyle at the last world short-course championships in Brazil in 1995, proved his powers over the longer distance with a clearcut victory in 47.86 seconds.

Sanchez, the fastest final qualifier and bronze medallist in 1995, went through the halfway mark just 0.01 seconds outside Alexander Popov's world record schedule but could not sustain that exceptional pace.
Brazil's Gustavo Borges, who retained his 200 freestyle title on Thursday, repeated his 1995 placing in the 100 by taking the silver medal in 48.16.
Australia's Michael Klim, the 100 butterfly bronze medallist, took another bronze in 48.21.
Defending champion Fernando Scherer of Brazil failed to make the final, having finished 17th overall in the morning's heats.
